to be placed on the air, ICA will give careful consideration to requests

4» On.the same basis as in other fields, ICA will favorably
consider requests for participant training of managerial, programming, and
engiheering personnel for television installations ®
5o ICA will continue to explore the possibility of developing
low cost, simplified television receivers. Such information will be made
available to all countries• Where transmission facilities exist ICA will
consider specific proposals for the provision of television receivers
for schools, community centers or other appropriate places for use as a
part of programs designed to educate or train specific groups by television.
ICA will further consider requests for study of the feasibility of estab¬
lishing receiver assembly plants in host countries and will assist in the
establishment of such plants when circumstances justify such action®
b0 While consideratidh of such support remains a possibility,
it is not the intent of ICA, under normal circumstances, to provide
substantial assistance for the installation of high power television
Stations or national television systems. For such installations, ICA
will normally consider supporting feasibility studies and the training of
key personnel®
7® ICA will provide substantial support for the installation
of high power television stations and national television systems when the
circumstances are especially compelling® Such circunstances would include;
Actual dr imminent Bloc action in this regard; the need for a particularly
dramatic project with wide popular appeal; and the unusually insistent
demands of a key figure controlling the government of a friendly country®
8® ICA policy in connection with the development of television
facilities will be reviewed periodically to insure that it is consistent
with the worldwide development of the medium®
